items.title: Defined-contribution system
items.short: ZUS works like a piggy bank — what you put in is what you later take out.
items.body: ZUS works like a piggy bank — what you put in is what you later take out (well… almost). Your contributions don't vanish; they quietly grow.

items.title: Defined-contribution system
items.short: Since 1999 ZUS computes pensions based on the sum of contributions.
items.body: Since 1999 ZUS computes pensions based on the sum of contributions recorded on your account. The higher the contributions, the higher the benefit.

items.title: Initial capital (pre-1999)
items.short: If you worked before 1999, ZUS recalculates what you'd have 'saved' in the old world.
items.body: If you worked before 1999, ZUS recalculates what you'd have 'saved' in the old world — a bit like converting old PLN to new, but for pensions.

items.title: Initial capital (pre-1999)
items.short: For periods before 1999, ZUS establishes the 'initial capital'.
items.body: For periods before 1999, ZUS establishes the 'initial capital', i.e., the notional value of contributions accrued in the old system, converted into the new formula.

items.title: Life expectancy (SDŻ)
items.short: ZUS divides your savings by how long you're statistically expected to live.
items.body: ZUS divides your savings by how long you're statistically expected to live. The later you retire, the smaller the divisor — and the higher the monthly amount.

items.title: Life expectancy (SDŻ)
items.short: The pension base is divided by the average remaining life expectancy.
items.body: The pension base is divided by the average remaining life expectancy (GUS table, window 1 April–31 March). Later retirement → smaller divisor → higher monthly benefit.

items.title: Indexation / Valorization of contributions
items.short: Each year ZUS adds some 'percent' so your savings don't lose value.
items.body: Each year ZUS adds some 'percent' so your savings don't lose value. An inflation shield for your pension pot.

items.title: Indexation / Valorization of contributions
items.short: Annually (1 June) ZUS valorizes the balance with the index for the prior year.
items.body: Annually (1 June) ZUS valorizes the balance recorded as of 31 January by the index for the prior year; quarterly valorization applies to amounts after 31 January.

items.title: Minimum pension
items.short: Even if you saved little, there's a floor — provided you meet the service requirements.
items.body: Even if you saved little, there's a floor — provided you meet the service requirements. A 'demo version' of a pension, but it helps.

items.title: Minimum pension
items.short: If statutory contribution periods are met, the minimum pension is granted.
items.body: If statutory contribution periods are met, the minimum pension is granted regardless of low accrual (exact thresholds/amounts per current law).

items.title: Women & men
items.short: Women retire earlier, so ZUS divides their pot by more months.
items.body: Women retire earlier, so ZUS divides their pot by more months — often a smaller monthly amount (but enjoyed longer).

items.title: Women & men
items.short: Different retirement ages imply different divisors.
items.body: Different retirement ages imply different divisors; ceteris paribus this may yield lower monthly benefits for women.

items.title: Very low ('penny') pensions
items.short: Yes, some people receive PLN 5 per month — not a joke.
items.body: Yes, some people receive PLN 5 per month — not a joke. ZUS aggregates those into less frequent, larger payouts so you actually feel something.

items.title: Very low ('penny') pensions
items.short: For marginal accrual, ZUS may pay in a different cadence.
items.body: For marginal accrual, ZUS may pay in a different cadence or aggregate payments according to regulations.

items.title: Bridging (early) pensions
items.short: Some jobs wear you out faster — miners, pilots, steelworkers.
items.body: Some jobs wear you out faster — miners, pilots, steelworkers. They can retire earlier and ZUS recognizes it.

items.title: Bridging (early) pensions
items.short: Bridging pensions apply to specific professions.
items.body: Bridging pensions apply to specific professions and are financed by dedicated employer contributions.

items.title: Multi-country pensions (EU)
items.short: Worked across the EU? ZUS teams up with other countries.
items.body: Worked across the EU? ZUS teams up with other countries — an international pension coalition.

items.title: Multi-country pensions (EU)
items.short: Insurance periods from different EU states are aggregated.
items.body: Insurance periods from different EU states are aggregated under coordination rules; ZUS cooperates with foreign institutions to determine entitlements.

items.title: PUE ZUS calculator
items.short: On ZUS PUE you can preview your future pension. Make tea first.
items.body: On ZUS PUE you can preview your future pension. Make tea first — results can be… emotional.

items.title: PUE ZUS calculator
items.short: ZUS PUE provides scenarios for different retirement ages.
items.body: ZUS PUE provides scenarios for different retirement ages and contribution levels; results are indicative.
